welcome: HUDA - A Free Clinic Serving Metro Detroit
help: Helping the uninsured and under-insured of Metro Detroit
mission_statement: Our mission is to provide the best healthcare services to our community.
story_paragraph1: HUDA Clinic first opened its doors in May 2004 to serve the uninsured population of the Detroit area. The clinic initially operated on funds gathered by the Muslim community of Metro Detroit.
story_paragraph2: The HUDA Clinic initially offered only medical services at its original location within the Muslim Center of Detroit. After relocating to a larger facility on Woodrow Wilson Street, we expanded our offerings to include comprehensive dental, vision, podiatry, and mental health services, along with various specialty services, all provided at no cost to our patients. This expansion of services and extended operating hours was made possible through the generous support of our donors and volunteers.
facilities_text: At Huda Clinic, we pride ourselves on our staff, equipped with caliber medical technology to ensure our patients receive the best possible care.
chairman_text: Mission Statement: "Improving the lives of those in need through comprehensive health care, education, and resources." - Dr. Jukaku Tayeb, Chairman
proud_members: Proud Members in Good Standing with:
our_team_description: Get to know the dedicated professionals who make up our team.
our_mission_description: Learn about our mission to provide exceptional healthcare services.
mission_quote: "Improving the lives of those in need through comprehensive healthcare, education, and resources."
origins_expansion_text: HUDA Clinic first opened its doors in May 2004 to serve the uninsured population of Detroit, initially funded by the Muslim community of Metro Detroit. From its beginnings at the Muslim Center of Detroit, the clinic relocated to a larger facility on Woodrow Wilson Street, enabling an expansion of services.
comprehensive_services_text: Originally providing only medical services, HUDA Clinic now offers dental, vision, podiatry, mental health, and a wide range of specialty services—all at no cost to patients. This expansion has been made possible through the support of donors and volunteers.
mission_vision_text: Our mission is to improve the lives of those in need through comprehensive healthcare, education, and resources. We strive to provide free, quality healthcare to the uninsured and underinsured, with no fees or third-party reimbursements.
diverse_services_text: HUDA Clinic provides free primary care, dental care, mental health services, vision care, and specialty care. We offer preventative screenings, health assessments, chronic illness management, and referrals to specialists as needed.
community_impact_text: Each year, HUDA Clinic provides over 3,500 services to more than 1,200 unique individuals. As the largest free clinic in Michigan, we make a significant impact on the health and well-being of the community.
access_affordability_text: We never charge fees or seek reimbursements from insurance companies or government programs. Instead, our operations are funded by donations from generous supporters, ensuring that our services remain free for those in need.
donor_support_text: 80% of our annual operating budget is funded through donations from generous individuals and organizations. Every donation, big or small, makes a real difference in the lives of people in Metro-Detroit.
volunteerism_leadership_text: Our success is built on the dedication of physician volunteers and passionate student leaders. Together, they help us achieve our mission and provide high-quality care to our patients.
community_partnerships_text: HUDA Clinic is deeply connected to the community through partnerships with homeless shelters, non-profit organizations, religious groups, and local universities. These collaborations enable us to extend our reach and enhance the services we provide.

header.title: Free Community Health Services
header.description: Improving the lives of those in need through comprehensive healthcare, education and resources

ourServices.title: Our Services
ourServices.description: Explore our wide range of healthcare services designed to meet the diverse needs of our community.
ourServices.findCareDescription: Our comprehensive healthcare services are designed to cater to all your medical needs. Explore our offerings and discover how we can support your well-being.

primaryCare.title: Primary Care
primaryCare.description: Primary care providers address general health concerns, offering education, medications, and referrals. HUDA serves uninsured and under-insured individuals in Metro Detroit with preventative care and specialized services. We aim to improve Michigan's health with free medications and no-cost lab services.

dentalCare.title: Dental Care
dentalCare.description: Many people delay dental work due to lack of insurance, but small problems can become painful if ignored. Visit HUDA for cleanings, fillings, extractions, and exams to maintain healthy teeth. We also provide referrals to specialists if needed.
services: Referrals to low cost dentists as needed

mentalHealth.title: Mental Health
mentalHealth.description: Our psychiatrists and social workers offer free therapy and treatment for veterans, the homeless, uninsured, and underinsured. Since COVID-19, our psychiatry services are via telemedicine. Our volunteer team includes two psychiatrists, a nurse practitioner, and a therapist.

visionCare.title: Vision Care
visionCare.description: Vision screenings effectively identify visual impairments or eye conditions that could lead to vision loss. We conduct screenings in-house and offer free eyewear and referrals to affordable local ophthalmologists when needed.

specialtyCare.title: Specialty Care
specialtyCare.description: In medicine, many sub-specialties coordinate patient care. At HUDA, we offer various specialty care and consultations to expand healthcare access. Our integrated health model provides multiple specialty services to meet most patient needs. All specialty services require a referral from a HUDA primary care provider.

newPatientInfo.title: New Patient Information
newPatientInfo.description1: New patients are always welcome at the HUDA Clinic! You can schedule your initial appointment by visiting our clinic during our regular hours, or you may also come for a walk-in appointment before 10:30 AM, or until we reach our capacity on the days we offer walk-ins (see below).
newPatientInfo.description2: New patients must bring with them a valid photo ID, and must be at least 18 years old.

donate_header.title: Donate
donate_header.description: Support our mission by donating to the clinic or the urban garden

clinic.title: Donate to the Clinic
clinic.description: Your donation will help us provide high-quality medical care to those in need.

garden.title: Donate to the Garden
garden.description: Your donation will help us maintain and expand our beautiful community garden.

newsletter_header.title: Join Our Newsletter
newsletter_header.description: Stay Informed. Get Updates on Our Free Medical Services, Community Events, and Health Tips!

newPatient_header.title: Patient Signup
newPatient_header.description: Speed up your visit by filling out your information online.

footer.supportText: We couldn't do what we do without donations from people just like you. Every donation, big or small, makes a real difference in the lives of people in Metro-Detroit. Donate today.
